conclusion: Consider the position and size of each object relative to the light source.
Object A is a cake with a red topping located above the slabs.
When the light source moves to the back right, the shadow of the cake will shift to the back right and its size will remain the same.
Object B is a roll of toilet paper with a red cross on it located above the slabs.
When the light source moves to the back right, the shadow of the toilet paper will shift to the back right and its size will remain the same.
Object C is a ring located above the slabs.
When the light source moves to the back right, the shadow of the ring will shift to the back right and its size will remain the same.
Object D is a needle located above the slabs.
When the light source moves to the back right, the shadow of the needle will shift to the back right and its size will remain the same.
In summary, the shadows of all four objects will shift to the back right and their sizes will remain the same.
